review_title: Conflicted - Great Job / Majority Good People / Heavy Politics and stepping on others if you want to move forward
pros: Cares for employees, their families and the community; fair pay and benefits.  For the most part, this was the best job I had
cons:
The biggest problem is the lack of communication. Communication stops at the executive level. It goes up to them and down to them. Most things don't go any farther.  So the "worker bees" never really know what is going on, including the impact on their jobs. They find out at the last minute and have to scramble instead of being aware at the beginning and having the ability to prepare. 

Politics have gotten worse. It is really sad, because David doesn't realize.  David and his predecessor Edmundo, really have an open door policy. They take the time to talk to whomever comes by.

cons: Office location, long hours, market-rate wages if lucky

- Management and employees entitlement/ belief they are better than the community they are serving

review_title: Established NonProfit Taking A Fresh Direction
pros: Close knit and almost "family" feel to organization. An assortment of opportunities for professional growth. Flexibility with management provided your fulfilling your duties.
cons: Some people within the organization are entrenched in their own ways.  Because of the size of the organization, many other employees do not know or understand what the other departments do.

pros: I have been with CPLC for just over two years. I have an amazing boss and his boss is just as amazing. CPLC is highly innovative and very supportive. I've had excellent opportunity to grow within the organization. At CPLC it does feel like family. I give CPLC the highest of recommendations and I can't wait to see what we do next.
cons: I haven't found one yet in two years and I don't expect to.

review_title: Wanna Make a Difference? You can at CPLC
pros:
-Open access to upper management
-Opportunity to make your ideas and voice heard on many topics impacting our communities 
-Seeing how your efforts are impacting families in real time
-Community service opportunities and projects as an employee 
-Great wellness program
-Several programs within three states with employment opportunity
cons:
-Typical office politics that you can find anywhere (its an organization not a unicorn)
-Slow response time can be annoying, so patience is a needed and practiced skill
-Resources are stretched ( typically found in all nonprofits)

pros: Great sense of family. Competitive benefits. Opportunity to growth if you are in the right program.
